data.content: (Kỹ thuật) bóp chân/đầu nối

verb
crimps; crimped; crimping
[+ obj] to make the surface or edge of (hair, cloth, metal, etc.) have many small waves or folds
She crimps her hair with a curling iron.
Crimp the edges of the pie crust with a fork.
to press (parts or pieces) tightly together
Crimp the pieces of foil together.
US :to prevent (something) from happening or proceeding in the usual or desired way
economic problems that have been crimping [=putting a crimp in] sales in the computer industry
noun
plural crimps
[count] :a small wave or fold in the surface of something (such as hair or cloth)
put a crimp in
US :to prevent (something) from happening or proceeding in the usual or desired way :to affect (something) badly
The storm put a crimp in our travel plans.
The extra expenses put a crimp in the company's budget.
